Austin Energy Cap CostSandra CT Ozzie CT Jason CT cc Subject Austin Energy Cap Cost Sandra Attached is our best guess at a likely EPC cost full disclosure on our marginprofit guess I added gas compression per Janets note I still think we should pitch this without compression and add it if we need to I think that is Charles plan also Has Jim heard anything from Lone Star Jason I cant get Billys address to work through email would make sure he gets a copy gracias Bruce

City of Austin x LM OM EstimateForwarded by Jason R WiesepapeHOUECT on PM Scot NRONDEVELOPMENT PM To Jason NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Bruce GoldenENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Sandra NRONDEVELOPMENT Billy NRON Mark DoblerENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Tom CallaghanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mitch RobinsonENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT John W CatesENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Richard BickingsENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Karl MasaniENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject City of Austin x LM OM Estimate Jason please find attached the OM estimate for the City of Austin x LMPC gas fired simple cycle power project It shows the estimated cost for the Operators Mobilization Period kW and Annual Operating Period average FOM and average VOM for both year and year periods The estimate assumes the addition of operating staff at the project but that maintenance supervision and administration services can be performed by existing staffing at Austin Energy The staffing is such that the peak periods could be manned for round the clock availability and eased off in the nonpeak months I have shown an OM fee during Mobilization and Annual Operating Periods designed to cover this service as well as the Operators risk for meeting Availability requirements Per Sandras request I have not shown the GT and SCR reserve calculations in the estimate but for purposes of documenting with our team they are estimated to be GT Reserve fired hour year term SCR Reserve fired hour assume hr life Please review and call if you would like to discuss further regards Scot

Additional information for Rochester Could you please input this information into the model we are developing for the Rochester Project Thanks Russ Forwarded by Russ PorterCorpEnron on AM Oscar CT PM To Russ NRON cc Subject Additional information for Rochester We can respond outside of the formal RFP if we get something to them soon They want to see if we have anything to offer In the meantime they will go forward with their RFP Do not factor in any cost for the gas pipeline The local distribution company will absorbe the cost and go at risk for new incremental load The cost to go through the LDC is centsmmbtu on a variable or usage basis cents for transport and cents for service fee Peoples gas aggregates gas purchases for a number of customers in the region and purchases gas month to month RPU pays a fixed gas price that changes month to month We would need to add centsmmbtu to gas price from our curves Substation work should be approximately MM and no higher than mm As a point of reference RPUs estimate for a fully installed LM is MM They break this out to MM for turbine and generator MM engineering cost k winter package and MM other stuff RPU will have a gas pressure guarantee of so we need to have a calculation done on the cost of compression to step up from to My guess is that it will be around mm I would like to have something to Rochester by mid next week We can use the routine page proposal format

Hartwell preliminary OM estimateForwarded by Jason R WiesepapeHOUECT on PM Scot NRONDEVELOPMENT PM To Jason NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Hartwell preliminary OM estimate Jason please review the subject estimate and call should you have any questions Please consider it to have accuracy My cell is Talk to you later
